alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 13 at 5:22PM AKST until December 15 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM WEDNESDAY TO 9 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 9 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch or less. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...From 9 PM Wednesday to 9 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow accumulations are expected near the Inlet from Nikiski to Soldotna to Ninilchik including the Sterling Highway. A period of mixed precipitation late Wednesday night through Thursday morning may occur south of Kasilof and from Sterling east to Cooper Landing. Closer to Homer, snow will transition to rain Wednesday evening and back to snow late Thursday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
